mantle.firestore.db package¶

Submodules¶

mantle.firestore.db.errors module¶

exception mantle.firestore.db.errors.InvalidPropertyError(prop_name, model_name)¶

Bases: Exception

Raised if a non-existent field is provided during the creation of a model

exception mantle.firestore.db.errors.InvalidValueError(field, value)¶

Bases: ValueError

Raised if the value of a field does not fit the field type

exception mantle.firestore.db.errors.MalformedQueryError(message)¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when the rules of a query are broken

exception mantle.firestore.db.errors.ReferenceFieldError(message)¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when a reference field point’s to a location the model can’t resolve

exception mantle.firestore.db.errors.SubCollectionError(message)¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when conditions of a subcollection are not met

mantle.firestore.db.fields module¶

class mantle.firestore.db.fields.BooleanField(default=None, required=False)¶

Bases: mantle.firestore.db.fields._Field

A boolean field, holds True or False

class mantle.firestore.db.fields.BytesField(default=None, required=False)¶

Bases: mantle.firestore.db.fields._Field

Stores values as bytes, can be used to save a blob

class mantle.firestore.db.fields.DateTimeField(default=None, required=False, auto_now=False, auto_add_now=False)¶

Bases: mantle.firestore.db.fields._Field

Holds a date time value, if auto_now is true the value you set will be overwritten with the current server value

Args:

default (datetime) required (bool): Enforce that this field can’t be submitted when empty auto_now (bool): Set to the current time every time the model is updated auto_add_now (bool): Set to the current time when a record is created

validate(value)¶
class mantle.firestore.db.fields.DictField(required=False, default=None)¶

Bases: mantle.firestore.db.fields._Field

Holds an Dictionary of JSON serializable field data usually

The value of this field can be a dict or a valid json string. The string will be converted to a dict

Bases: mantle.firestore.db.fields._Field

This field stores a 64-bit signed integer

Bases: mantle.firestore.db.fields._Field, list

A List field

validate(value)¶
class mantle.firestore.db.fields.ReferenceField(model, required=False)¶

Bases: mantle.firestore.db.fields._Field

A field referencing/pointing to another model.

Args:
model Type(Model): The model at which this field will be referencing
NOTE:
A referenced model must meet one of the following:

  1. In the same subcollection as the current model

  2. In a static subcollection defined by a string path

  3. At the to level of the database

required (bool): Enforce that this model not store empty data

validate(value)¶
class mantle.firestore.db.fields.StringField(default=None, length=None, required=False)¶

Bases: mantle.firestore.db.fields._Field

A string field

validate(value)¶

mantle.firestore.db.model module¶

class mantle.firestore.db.model.Model(__parent__: Optional[mantle.firestore.db.model.Model] = None, **data)¶

Bases: object

Creates a firestore document under the collection [YourModel]

Args:
__parent__ Optional(Model.__class__): If this is a sub-collection of another model,

give an instance of the parent

**data (kwargs): Values for fields in the new record, e.g User(name=”Bob”)

Attributes:
id (str or int): Unique id identifying this record,

if auto-generated, this is not available before put()

__sub_collection__ (str of Model)(Optional class attribute):
1: A Model class where each document in this

model is a sub-collection of a record in the returned Model. e.g If you have a User model and each User has a collection of Notes. The model Notes would return User

2: A path representing a collection if you don’t want your Model to be on the root of the current

database, e.g In a shared database: sales

__database_props__ Tuple(Project, Credentials, database): A tuple of Project, Credentials and database in

that order provide these values if you are not working on App Engine environment or any other case where you need to the Project, Credentials and the database that the model is going to use

delete()¶

Delete the document connected to this model from firestore

classmethod get(_id, __parent__=None)¶

Get a model with the given id

Args:
_id (str or int): A key or id of the model record, when a list is provided, get returns a list

models

__parent__ (Model): If querying a sub collection of model, provide the parent instance

Returns:

Model: An instance of the firestore model calling get None: If the id provided doesn’t exist

put()¶

Save the models data to Firestore

Raises:

InvalidValueError: Raised if the value of a field is invalid, e.g. A required field that’s None

classmethod query(offset=0, limit=0, __parent__=None)¶

Create a query to this model

Args:

offset (int): The position in the database where the results begin limit (int): Maximum number of records to return __parent__ (Model): If querying a sub collection of model, provide the parent instance

Returns:

An iterable query object

mantle.firestore.db.query module¶

class mantle.firestore.db.query.Query(model, offset: int, limit: int, collection, parent)¶

Bases: object

A query object is returned when you call Model.query(). You can iterate over the query to get the results of your query one by one. Each item is an instance of a Model

contains(field, value)¶

A query condition where value in field

Args:

field (str): The name of a field to compare value (Any): The value to compare from the field

Returns:

Query: A query object with this condition added

Raises:
MalformedQueryError: If the field specified is not a ListField, or

the query has more than one contains condition

equal(field, value)¶

A query condition where field == value

Args:

field (str): The name of a field to compare value (Any): The value to compare from the field

Returns:

Query: A query object with this condition added

fetch()¶

Get the results of the query as a list

Returns:

list (Model): A list of models for the found results

greater_than(field, value)¶

A query condition where field > value

Args:

field (str): The name of a field to compare value (Any): The value to compare from the field

Returns:

Query: A query object with this condition added

A query condition where field >= value

Args:

field (str): The name of a field to compare value (Any): The value to compare from the field

Returns:

Query: A query object with this condition added

less_than(field, value)¶

A query condition where field < value

Args:

field (str): The name of a field to compare value (Any): The value to compare from the field

Returns:

Query: A query object with this condition added

less_than_or_equal(field, value)¶

A query condition where field <= value

Args:

field (str): The name of a field to compare value (Any): The value to compare from the field

Returns:

Query: A query object with this condition added

order_by(field, direction='ASC')¶

Set an order for the query, accepts

Args:

field (str): The field name to order by direction (str: “ASC” or “DESC”), optional:

Returns:

Query: A query object with order applied
